resources.string:
"About My University 

"
"My University is Android application which helps students to easily track university timetables, deadlines and announcements. It is follows Client-to-Client (C2C) business model. In our case, it is student-to-student application. No, universities or university staff are required or used for the correct functioning of the application. 

"
"How does it work? 

"
"When students are creating their accounts,they can either select Course Representatives or Students as their student types. Being Course Representative allows students to create and modify timetables, deadlines and announcements. On the other hand, being Student only allows the privilege to view the content only. Thus, active students at universities are recommended to be CRs. 

"
"How do I join my group? 

"
"Whenever student tries to join a group, he/she cannot directly or immediately join the group. Due to security issues and recommendation provided by students, new members who are planning to join a group need to go through Open Voting System. 

"
"What is Open Voting System? 

"
"Open Voting System â€“ creates a request from User X for the group Group X for which he/she wishes to join. Then, all members in that Group X start voting or kicking the User X from the group. On condition that user collects more than 60% accept rate within the next 24 hours, User X will automatically join the group. Otherwise, User X will be kicked and his/her request will be deleted. 

"
"How can I vote? 

"
"Already-joined members of the group can easily vote for incoming students who wishes to join their group by going Requests subsection in Chats Section of the application. All of the incoming requests will be listed there. 

"
"About creating groups 

"
"On condition that a user is creating a new group which does not exist yet in the database, he/she and the next 2 students can join the group automatically. They will not be required to go through Open Voting System. 

"
